job_title: Programme Manager - Office of the CEO
job_description:
Programme Manager - Office of the CEO

About Us

Way.com is America’s dominant automotive super app, powering every mile for over 10 million customers—from auto insurance and parking to EV charging and more. Leveraging cutting-edge AI, machine learning, and advanced data analytics, we deliver innovative, personalized solutions that transform car ownership. Featured by Bloomberg and ranked 48th on Andreessen Horowitz’s Marketplace list of fastest-growing companies worldwide and recognized as the top Product in Insurance by UnitQ, we’re making car ownership easier, more affordable, and more rewarding.

Role Overview

A high-impact role for a decisive, no-nonsense leader who can cut through bureaucracy, enforce accountability, and deliver results. The Programme Manager will run the CEO’s office with authority, ensuring priorities are clear, actions are executed, and outcomes are delivered.

Key Responsibilities

  • Execute CEO Directives: Translate the CEO’s vision and decisions into clear, actionable initiatives and ensure timely execution.
  • Eliminate Barriers: Anticipate challenges, remove obstacles, and bypass unnecessary processes to maintain momentum.
  • Enforce Deadlines and Budgets: Drive accountability to ensure all deliverables are completed within defined timelines and financial parameters.
  • Provide Actionable Insights: Present the CEO with well-analyzed solutions and strategic recommendations, not unresolved issues.
  • Strengthen Leadership Accountability: Hold senior leaders responsible for commitments, ensuring decisive actions and strong execution.
  • Streamline Operations: Simplify processes and align workflows to enhance speed, transparency, and efficiency across teams.
  • Drive Closure: Track initiatives, projects, and escalations to full resolution—leaving no tasks or issues pending.
  • Support CEO Effectiveness: Manage priorities, workload, and scheduling to safeguard the CEO’s focus, mental clarity, and long-term effectiveness.

Preferred Skills/Qualifications

  • Education: Engineering degree or Management Degree (MBA/PGDM).
  • Experience: 7–12 years in programme management, strategy, or senior executive roles.
  • Proven Track Record: Delivered outcomes in high-pressure, complex environments.
  • Commanding Presence: Able to influence, lead, and enforce across the organization.
  • Mindset: Relentless, disciplined, outcome-obsessed.
  • Judgment & Discretion: Trusted to manage sensitive personal and professional matters for the CEO.

Success Metrics

  • Project Delivery: 100% of strategic programmes and high-priority projects delivered on time and within budget.
  • Decision Enablement: CEO receives actionable information within deadlines 100% of the time.
  • Accountability Enforcement: Zero unresolved staff or departmental issues beyond agreed timelines.
  • Process Efficiency: Key processes are reviewed, streamlined, and operating at maximum clarity and speed.
  • Cross-Functional Alignment: Initiatives executed without misalignment or delays across functions.
  • CEO Mental & Physical Wellbeing: Ensure CEO maintains focus and avoids overload; proactive management of schedule and high-stress situations.

Why You Will Love Working With Us

  • Opportunity to work for the #1 Auto Super app in the US.
  • Opportunity to make a meaningful impact across 10+ million users.
  • Dynamic, fast-paced, and innovation-driven work culture.
  • Clear pathways for career growth in a rapidly scaling technology company.
  • Competitive compensation.

Contact Information

Email: careers@way.com
summary: Way.com is seeking a Programme Manager to drive the CEO's initiatives, enforce accountability, and streamline operations. The ideal candidate will have 7-12 years of experience in programme management or strategy.

job_description:
Content QA Specialist

Way.com is seeking a detail-oriented Content QA Specialist to serve as the final gatekeeper before content is published. This role extends beyond standard proofreading—you will ensure every blog, article, and landing page meets the highest standards of accuracy, originality, SEO performance, and brand consistency. Your expertise will be critical in identifying low-quality or AI-generated content, maintaining compliance with Google’s EEAT principles (Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, Trustworthiness), and enhancing overall content effectiveness.

About Us

Way.com is America’s dominant automotive super app, powering every mile for over 10 million customers—from auto insurance and parking to EV charging and more. Leveraging cutting-edge AI, machine learning, and advanced data analytics, we deliver innovative, personalized solutions that transform car ownership. Featured by Bloomberg and ranked 48th on Andreessen Horowitz’s Marketplace list of fastest-growing companies worldwide and recognized as the top Product in Insurance by UnitQ, we’re making car ownership easier, more affordable, and more rewarding.

Work Arrangement: On-site

Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities

Content Review & Editorial Excellence

  • Review blogs, articles, and landing pages for grammar, clarity, tone, and alignment with brand voice.
  • Correct factual errors, improve phrasing, and resolve formatting issues to maintain high editorial quality.

SEO & Performance Optimization

  • Evaluate on-page SEO elements including meta tags, headers, internal linking, and keyword usage.
  • Analyze content depth, relevance, and user value; flag material that lacks substance or actionable insights.

AI & Plagiarism Detection

  • Identify AI-generated or low-quality content through manual assessment and automated tools.
  • Perform plagiarism checks to ensure originality and protect brand credibility.

EEAT & Credibility Assurance

  • Validate author credentials and verify sources, particularly for YMYL (Your Money or Your Life) topics.
  • Ensure all content meets EEAT standards to enhance authority, expertise, and trustworthiness.

QA Process Enhancement

  • Maintain and refine QA checklists, processes, and best practices for consistent quality.
  • Provide clear, constructive feedback to writers and editors to drive continuous improvement.

Preferred Skills

  • Minimum of 2 years’ experience in content quality assurance, editing, or SEO.
  • Exceptional manual editing skills with strong attention to detail.
  • Solid understanding of SEO fundamentals and Google’s content quality guidelines.
  • Ability to identify AI-generated content and assess it for human readability.
  • Proficiency with tools such as Grammarly, Copyscape, Copyleaks, Originality.ai, or similar.
  • Skilled at identifying low-value or thin content and providing actionable improvement recommendations.
  • Comfortable working in a high-volume, fast-paced content production environment.
  • Educational or professional background in journalism, digital marketing, or technical writing.
  • Experience with content management systems such as WordPress.
  • Familiarity with structured data, Yoast SEO plugin, and content scoring tools.
  • Understanding of content compliance processes and fact-checking workflows.

Why you will love working with us?

  • Opportunity to work for the #1 Auto Super app in the US.
  • Opportunity to make a meaningful impact across 10+ million users.
  • Dynamic, fast-paced, and innovation-driven work culture.
  • Clear pathways for career growth in a rapidly scaling technology company.
  • Competitive compensation.
